query: According to the graph, what must be done to the bottom of the excavation before blinding?
Is a trip ticket required to confirm the disposal of asbestos waste?
Which clause mandates TEMPORARY PROTECTIVE MULCHING?
Under what timing constraint should samples be taken from a CAULDRON (constraint: state when relative to the charge remaining)?
Which is greater — the maximum spacing of COURSING CENTERS or the maximum length on bed of stones in RANDOM RUBBLE?
Are cant strips installed to ensure proper adhesion of the waterproofing membrane?
Do SAFETY NETS serve the primary function of catching falling objects or people to prevent injuries?
Are SITE LEVELS measurements of ground elevation that must be checked for accuracy before excavation or earthwork begins?
Which pieces of equipment use BUCKETS to transport materials — the CAULDRON or the MIXER?
Which equipment is used primarily to view the live video signals at the site office: TV MONITORS or VIDEO CAMERAS?
Which role is responsible for on-site supervision of demolition activities, and which role works under their immediate supervision?
Do blasting operations require monitoring of effects such as noise and safety?
Is further deposition halted if underlying soil layers fail compaction tests?
Must the oversite topographical survey be conducted by a firm listed in the List of Approved Suppliers of Materials and Specialist Contractors for Public Works?
What does the approved laboratory analyze with respect to insulation material?
Is masonry in cement mortar used to build up spaces in rock cuttings?

For parts of the site identified as both SPECIAL FEATURES and CRITICAL AREAS that may affect public and on-site personnel safety, which process must be applied according to the graph? (Constraint: areas must be both SPECIAL FEATURES and CRITICAL AREAS.)
Which demolition method is designated as the default to be adopted for the project, and who is required to adopt it unless specified otherwise?
Does Clause 2.1 specify requirements for using tarpaulin material?
Do CONTROL TESTS determine the optimum placing thickness and number of passes for compaction?
Is the second coat applied over the first coat after at least 24 hours of curing?
For vertical termination points, what recess groove dimension must be provided to tuck the waterproofing membrane into (constraint: specified recess groove dimension)?
Which relates to the order of driving piles versus which relates to a sheet pile being joined from multiple sections — SEQUENCE OF DRIVING or SPLICED?
What test is conducted to ensure the integrity of the full containment method?
Must the video records produced by the video cameras be retained and kept available for inspection for a minimum period of 14 days after the recording is made?
Who certifies the electrical disconnection process?
Which of NOISE and VIBRATION is described as needing mitigation and which as needing control in the demolition context?
Which department issues the Code of Practice - Safety and Health at Work with Asbestos?

Which materials are directly connected to PEAT and explicitly described as "unsuitable materials"? (Constraint: must be direct relationships from PEAT whose description contains "unsuitable materials".)
Which is appointed by the contractor and has specified academic qualifications and experience: BUILDING SERVICES COORDINATOR or PRELIMINARY WORKS?
Which material is explicitly prohibited from being used to coat buckets?
Should sampling from a cauldron occur when approximately half of the charge remains?
Who must comply with the Air Pollution Control (Construction Dust) Regulation?
There are two UNDER-DRAINING entries— which one describes infrastructure necessary for filling on sloping ground and which one describes the process of draining water from the site?

When flammable liquids or gases are present on site, what specific preventive requirement must be applied during the demolition operation to avoid fire or explosion? (Constraint: answer must link the presence of flammable liquids/gases to the required fire/explosion prevention during demolition.)
According to the graph, where should stacked spoil be placed to facilitate direct loading?
Does Clause 11.4 specify the properties that sheet membrane samples must comply with during sampling and testing?
What are temporary watercourses used for in relation to excavation and earthwork areas?
Which adjacent entity serves as a reference point for obstructed pile heights, ADJACENT PILES or ADJACENT PROPERTIES, and which requires protection during demolition and construction works?
According to Geospec 3, what equipment is specified for moisture content tests?
Are COURSING CENTERS used to lineup with QUOIN AND JAMB STONES as reference points?

Which clause explicitly specifies the required properties for sheet membrane sampling and testing, and under that sampling-and-testing process where must samples be delivered for testing (constraint: clause specifies properties for sheet membrane; samples are delivered as part of that sampling and testing process)?
What type of earth may be encountered during excavation?
Which document provides guidance for clearing Mikania micrantha?

Which safety features are explicitly described as precautionary measures to catch falling debris during demolition operations (Constraint: answer must be entities whose primary function is to catch falling debris and are implemented alongside other demolition safety measures)?
Which activity explicitly requires monitoring of effects on surrounding structures: sheet piling work or dewatering?

Which regulations related to the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance address (a) lifting appliances and lifting gear and (b) noise at work? (Constraint: must be regulations related to the FACTORIES AND INDUSTRIAL UNDERTAKINGS ORDINANCE and specifically on those topics.)

Which component of soil-cement must be free from organic matter and contain no more than 30% of soil particles passing a 63 micrometers BS test sieve (i.e., identify the component constrained by this particle-size and organic-matter limit)?
Who determines compliance of masonry based on sample panels?
Which entry describes the dimensional specification for wall ties: 20x3 mm flats or Stainless steel 316 (material composition)?

In the context of rock cuttings, what (a) material is specified as needing removal and (b) tool is specified for testing rock fragments? Constraint: select only items that are directly connected to ROCK CUTTINGS in the graph.
What is required to verify compliance when recompaction is carried out?

Which equipment, described as a physical barrier that controls and mitigates dispersion of dust and is explicitly included in PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES (constraint: must be EQUIPMENT, control dust, and be part of PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES)?
Which processes explicitly involve delivering samples to PUBLIC WORKS LABORATORIES (PWL): BULK SAMPLE delivery or SAMPLING AND TESTING?
At what locations are noise levels measured to ensure compliance with specified limits?
Which included detail in the stone works mock up sample is a process rather than a material: Pointing or Damp proof course?
Which structural elements must be calibrated at 1-meter intervals along their length to permit checking by the SO (i.e., subject to the 1m interval calibration constraint)?
Which backfilled elements explicitly require a minimum RC of at least 90%? (Constraint: list structures that are specified as requiring RC ≥ 90% for their backfill.)
Which entity certifies electrical disconnection for demolition works, and which entity provides the incoming electricity supply: REGISTERED ELECTRICAL WORKER or SUPPLY COMPANY?
Which items are stated to require strict application or construction in accordance with the Manufacturer's instructions?
Which National Annex to BS EN 1996-1-1 must granite comply with?

Which waterproofing material must be submitted for approval by the SO and meet an elongation capability of not less than 400% to accommodate cracks up to 2mm (constraints: must be submitted to the SO for approval; elongation >= 400%)?

Which task, conducted well in advance of excavation to form a cut rock face (constraint: conducted well in advance of excavation), requires both explosives and blast-holes with specific specifications?
Is GRANITE required to comply with the National Annex to BS EN 1996-1-1?
Are CATCHFANS described as devices designed to catch falling debris or materials during demolition work?
What is the vibratory plate compactor used to do to the trimmed formation?
Is the Contractor required to adopt the Top Down Method for demolition unless specified otherwise?

When performing selective demolition and on-site sorting, which document provides the guidelines for storage, segregation, and disposal of demolition waste that must be followed? (Constraint: must be the document specifically for selective demolition and on-site sorting.)
For which is a HIGH EFFICIENCY PARTICULATE ABSOLUTE VACUUM CLEANER used: ASBESTOS WASTE or ASBESTOS REMOVAL WORKS?

Which material is specified as the backing or core for squared rubble walling that exceeds 300mm in thickness and also has individual stone dimensions with height 75mm–300mm and length/depth constraints (constraint: used as backing/core for walls > 300mm thickness)?
Which document becomes the official measurement of earthwork quantities after being endorsed by both parties?

Which filling material must (a) have less than 90% passing a 20mm British Standard (BS) test sieve as specified, (b) contain no individual piece exceeding 200mm in its largest dimension, and (c) be compacted to achieve a relative compaction of at least 90% — and is subject to compaction requirements specified in TABLE 3.4 (all constraints must apply)?
What must be done to the bottom of the excavation before new work begins?
Must formation of rock fill be trimmed and blinded according to Clause 3.23?
Which calculations are described as a critical task in the demolition process?
Which is mandated by Clause 25.233: TEMPORARY PROTECTIVE FENCING or WARNING SIGNS?
Which material is specified to accommodate unanticipated cracks up to 0.6mm wide without losing waterproofing properties: Proprietary Flexible Sheet Membrane or Mastic Asphalt: Type T1097?
Under the constraint that an obstructed sheet pile remains significantly higher than the general top level of adjacent piles, which relationship describes the temporary measure that is required?
Which sampling approach specifies a sample mass of not less than 6kg: BULK SAMPLE or SAMPLING AND TESTING?
Which is explicitly described as being part of a complete waterproofing system — CEMENTITIOUS WATERPROOFING or PITCH MODIFIED POLYURETHANE?
Which more directly ensures the adhesion of the sheet membrane — the HIGH BOND PRIMER or MOULD OIL?
Is lime putty used in a slurry (with plaster and stone dust) to coat stone liable to stain?

When preparing specimens for hardness number tests (constraint: preparing specimens for hardness tests), what preparatory requirement for the spatula and what tapping duration constraint must be followed to level the mastic and remove entrapped air?
